result.execSummary:
The defendant Lionel L. Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lionel L. Alexander is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lionel L. Alexander was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay fine of $ 400.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lionel L. Alexander

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:36am-  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 4 years: 2 years initial confinement & 2 years extended supervision w/ conditions - concurrent to any sentence in 00CF182.  Credit for 156 days.  Court orders a $400.00 fine plus costs, drug surcharge & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  DE is not eligible for CIP.  DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal rights given.
Due to time constraints, Court adjourns sentencing hearing to 8/5/2014 at 10am.  Parties notified in court.
Sentencing hearing on July 31, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Martinez), 6/26/2014 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 7/31/2014 at 3pm.  NTBS by the Court.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:03pm-  State dismisses school enhancer on count 2.  Attorney Perz withdraws bond motion.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 1 is dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Bond continued.
to Modify Bail/Bond - filed by Attorney Matthew Perz    (4/23/2014 at 1:30pm)

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by Atty Perz.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-23-14 @ 1:30pm. Bond continued.

230pm
 ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matt Perz.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 3/11/14 @ 10am.  Atty Perz moves to dismiss both Cts.  Court denies motion.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(1)(cm)1r -Manu/Deliver Cocaine (>1G but <=5G), 2nd & Subsequent   961.41(1)(cm)1g -Manu/Deliver Cocaine (<=1G), On or Near a School, 2nd & Subsequent
